abstract: Oracle plans to take OpenOffice to the cloud and to keep selling the SunRay thin client. These moves have Oracle backing some of Sun’s more curious products.
snippet: Oracle plans to take OpenOffice to the cloud and to keep selling the SunRay thin client. These moves have Oracle backing some of Sun’s more curious products.
lead_paragraph: As I laid out in an article Wednesday, Oracle expects that through its acquisition of Sun Microsystems, it has a way to sell a full spectrum of hardware and software to business customers.

headline.main: Oracle to Live the Life Quixotic With Sun Products
